memberdef.argsstring: (char *cachedir, cache_content_flush_behaviour_t flushhow, unsigned int lw_mark_trigger_flag, time_t grace_period, unsigned int index, unsigned int mod, unsigned int *p_nb_flushed, unsigned int *p_nb_too_young, unsigned int *p_nb_errors, unsigned int *p_nb_orphans, fsal_op_context_t *pcontext, cache_content_status_t *pstatus)
memberdef.name: cache_content_emergency_flush

detaileddescription.para: cache_content_emergency_flush: Flushes the content of a file in the local cache to the FSAL data.
Flushes the content of a file in the local cache to the FSAL data. This routine should be called only from the cache_inode layer.
No lock management is done in this layer: the related pentry in the cache inode layer is locked and will prevent from concurent accesses.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] cachedir the filesystem where the cache resides
[IN] should we delete local files or not ?
[IN] shpuld we purge until low water mark is reached ?
[IN] grace_period The grace period for a file before being considered for deletion
[INOUT] pcontext the FSAL context for this operation

simplesect.para: CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS if successful, an error otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Emergency flush for forcing flush of data cached files to FSAL.

simplesect.para: $Revision$ cache_content_emergency_flush.c : Emergency flush for forcing flush of data cached files to FSAL.
